(Simplified: 觎)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 俞 indicates the sound; 見 (eye) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 俞 [ yú ] to consent, to approve; surname
    • 見 [ jiàn ] to see, to observe, to meet, to appear
①(覬覦)見“(覦)覬”。

［《廣韻》羊朱切，平虞，以。］

覦字的康熙字典解释

【酉集上】【見字部】　覦； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1135第39
【唐韻】羊朱切【集韻】【韻會】容朱切【正韻】雲俱切，?音兪。覬覦，欲得也。【左傳·襄十五年】能官人則民無覦心。【杜註】無覬覦以求幸。　又人名。【宋史·宗室表】修職郞覦之。　又通作窬。【劉琨·勸進表】狡?窺窬。【文選註】窬，與覦同。　又【廣韻】羊戍切【集韻】【韻會】兪戍切，?兪上聲。又【集韻】從遇切，音聚。義?同。

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[You Ji 1] [See the Department of Words] 　觎; Kangxi Strokes: 16; Page Number: Page 1135 Page 39
[Tang Yun] Sheep Zhu Cut [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] Rong Zhu Cut [Zheng Yun] Clouds are all cut,? Yin Yu. To be coveted is to desire. [Zuo Zhuan·Xiang Fifteen Years] The people who are able to be officials are not the people. [Du Note] No coveting for luck.　Another name. [Song History · Clan Table] Xiu Zhijun.　It's all over again. 【Liu Kun·Persuade to enter the table】Cunning? [Annotation to texts] 窬, the same as coveted.　[Guang Yun] Sheep cut cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] cut cut, sounded? Also 【Jiyun】Congyuqie, sound gathering. Righteous? Same.
